docs.snippet: Mr. Douglas, the Academy Award-winning star of "Wall Street," "Wonder Boys" and "Traffic," will be the honoree of the society's 37th annual Chaplin Award Gala....
docs.lead_paragraph: Michael Douglas says that when he's offered a lifetime achievement prize these days, he does an act of due diligence first. "I normally check how many cardiologists are on the review panel for the award, just to see if they know something that I don't," he said Monday in a telephone interview.
docs.abstract: Mr. Douglas, the Academy Award-winning star of "Wall Street," "Wonder Boys" and "Traffic," will be the honoree of the society's 37th annual Chaplin Award Gala.

headline.main: Michael Douglas to Be Honored By Film Society of Lincoln Center

headline.main: Campaign Commemorates Oscar’s Big Apple Connection (‘French’ and Otherwise)

docs.snippet: The Jacques Audiard film took home nine César awards, including best picture and best director, at France's equivalent of the Oscars....
docs.lead_paragraph: The widely praised Jacques Audiard film "A Prophet" ("Un Prophète"), already a grand prize winner at the 2009 Cannes Film Festival, added to its trophy collection on Saturday night when it was named best picture at the César awards, France's equivalent of the Oscars, Reuters reported. The film, about a young man of Arabic descent and his journey through the French prison system, took home nine Césars in all, including those for best director, original screenplay and cinematography, as well as acting awards for Tahar Rahim, who plays the central character, and Niels Arestrup, who plays an aging mob boss whose influence he falls under.
docs.abstract: The Jacques Audiard film took home nine César awards, including best picture and best director, at France's equivalent of the Oscars.

docs.snippet: As the remaining guilds hand out their awards, Oscar pool players can glean some intelligence for the costume, cinematography and visual effects categories....
docs.lead_paragraph: Hallelujah! What appear to be the last remaining guild awards before the Oscars have been handed out, but - drat! - in terms of keeping you ahead of your colleagues/friends/family members in the pool, there's only so much to celebrate. The Costume Guild recognized Sandy Powell for "The Young Victoria" and Monique Prudhomme for "The Imaginarium of Doctor Parnassus." Both are nominated for the best costume Oscar. The academy tends to favor period films (Ms. Powell) over fantasy (Ms. Prudhomme), though, so perhaps Lil Vicki has the edge.
docs.abstract: As the remaining guilds hand out their awards, Oscar pool players can glean some intelligence for the costume, cinematography and visual effects categories.

docs.snippet: The casting directors spent five months searching for the right person to play the title character before they found Gabourey Sidibe....
docs.lead_paragraph: Last week the Bagger spent some time auditioning for Billy Hopkins and Jessica Kelly, the casting directors for "Precious: Based on the Novel 'Push' by Sapphire" and other films, including "Boys Don't Cry." While we wait for their people to call our people, we thought we'd share some cutting-room floor details, like the fact that Mr. Hopkins is the ex-boyfriend of Lee Daniels, the director of "Precious."
docs.abstract: The casting directors spent five months searching for the right person to play the title character before they found Gabourey Sidibe.
